Efficiency measures

Source: R/structural-efficiency.R
efficiency.Rd

The global efficiency of a network is defined as the average of inverse distances. The local efficiency of a network around a vertex is the global efficiency of the subgraph after removing the vertex.

Usage

global_efficiency(graph, weights = numeric(0L), directed = is_directed(graph))

local_efficiency(
  graph,
  weights = numeric(0L),
  vids = integer(0L),
  directed = is_directed(graph),
  mode = 3L
)

average_local_efficiency(
  graph,
  weights = numeric(0L),
  directed = is_directed(graph),
  mode = 3L
)

Source

https://igraph.org/c/doc/igraph-Structural.html#efficiency-measures

Arguments

graph

An igraph_ptr object.

weights

A numeric vector of edge weights; TRUE to use Eattr(graph, "weight").

directed

A logical value, whether to consider directed paths. Ignored for undirected graphs.

vids

An integer vector of vertex IDs.

mode

An integer value of edge type to count; {1: OUT, 2: IN, 3: ALL}.

Value

A numeric vector.

Examples

g = graph_tree(7L, mode = 2L)
global_efficiency(g)
#> [1] 0.5634921

local_efficiency(g)
#> [1] 0 0 0 0 0 0 0

average_local_efficiency(g)
#> [1] 0
